87BDD28EC63341AB971E0466EE909090.description: Determine when to write for short or extended time frames

D13E745BB01A4277AED16B573F5FE648.description: Identify discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

B5532AD46C6642E68F734EBC90718478.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

17524E681A3C4FDC8FBC927AF3C0281D.description: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reason and evidence to support partticular points in a text").

96530589656F41EE960F6E5A91147EB7.description: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions].").

DACF9CE42A8E4CD6AAB79F8AEF16AF03.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

FC9FE7EEF03E4990904B69FFFE1653D4.description: Distinguish between relevant and irrelevant information gathered from experiences and/or print and digital sources

605755F6AD584D7AA028BB830A1CDCD3.description: Identify relevant experiences and gather relevant information from print and digital sources

96643C43B6A84B4081C826E981A11B64.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

34E0D272AB8E44B09A7AC393F07297E2.description: Participate in short research projects to gain knowledge

EB6EACDB6EB646E780E5DB9C06186305.description: Distinguish between relevant and irrelevant information

60A5F35943E04C62A2C06B757125CEEE.description: Identify different aspects of a topic using various sources and tools

B0C25922A25A42799609CF2B7547B863.description:
Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of
different aspects of a topic.

8CBCEA8C8C0F4C469349B60C3551B628.description: Use keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting

B0CC1823042946F6BDA4641D483C9327.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to communicate and collaborate with others

E8A98DFB576D4E2E89DC94CC002237A1.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, and keyboarding skills to produce and publish
writing

DCA3F256BB9B43AF9524A811E6D6E06A.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the
Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a
single sitting.

69C22B15249E4AAD9A8FBF6C9EFC6266.description: Develop and strengthen writing by editing

EABF0686A5DF4C7E941841BC110FC784.description: Develop and strengthen writing by revising

DEC1EB9E1E4E488EA391658C092814C0.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning

9658C3B9FEC64ACE8D1FBE8E3C89DE2F.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing
as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate
command of Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 4.)

78E2B07990F84901B12E33954FE172B9.description:
Use suitable development and organization appropriate to the task, purpose, or
audience

2E605ED1B54E495AA58ABDBD63BFD5A3.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are
appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types
are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

7F26B87E95374C4FA6597461216FF1CC.description: Identify how writers provide a conclusion

0EC908318C5941DDAEA935D3F08EF69E.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

69A53DA5AB45405CA3D9EA6BBBA5A486.description: Identify how writers use concrete words and phrases and sensory details

1A233044F7F24CDE9ED0DCD94FA1E3DB.description:
Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and
events precisely.

03D4187EE4564AEBBBB2B8EC40859253.description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

9E1C414BB9844AD1992539F7B4E58537.description:
Describe the use of dialogue and description to develop experiences, events, or
characters

9D420B638EDF4FB8B1E759CDDD651ED9.description:
Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the
responses of characters to situations.

DB3D9BEBEA344802A763CC3930AEBAB7.description: Identify narrator, characters, and story elements

0DEBB7DE9B1E4E26BFCCC5FF7E713C6C.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or
characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

799D1B4CAE644A14A64E97EDE9C8FD5A.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

9618AA36D2E9423A922F3DA79F151410.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or
explanation presented.

028618B1DA4C4DEB91E5D4100D025E05.description: Identify precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform or explain

F3720C38D8224C6BACDB39E901CC0303.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain
the topic.

48052D9B0AE0450FAB46E7E2906DBD40.description: Use transitional words and phrases to link ideas within categories of information

6790B5D29DB547399BDE7ACEDA85E56D.description:
Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g.,
another, for example, also, because).

8690C8C3BC6A45E4A39C754BAAB1FD8E.description:
Develop topics with facts, definitions, concrete details,quotations or other information and
examples

47CE71DD79974A0DA25C0B491196DA37.description: Identify the purpose of quotations in informational text

A3CE974F39254A14A9DA7BFA1D919905.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples related to the topic.

F549371F0DF04EE9A378A01BE053B9AA.description: Integrate formatting, illustrations and multimedia into writing to aid comprehension

2A84C2F752B74CDB86BC33434A480FA9.description: Explain how formatting, illustrations, and multimedia aid comprehension

C90855DF47DD4592AAD15921AB462115.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and
sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when
useful to aiding comprehension.

99D3078E64D948E9B2DAC130EE339E02.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and
information clearly.

F06F31C197AC4772AED82F3184798FA9.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

E3737C38B9B24B57912FBF56D77E96B5.description: Link opinions and reasons using transitional words and phrases

A1535883ACF642F891E64A84320A070C.description:
Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to,
in addition).

6FE0CE45812F4DABA57CF5E9461BB2D8.description: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details

FD3CD60D13664470B007A84072EAE9CD.description: Organize by grouping ideas to support writer’s purpose

342352DF0A1D43AFAF8E48DF6AD5FE94.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational
structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer's purpose.

7CCF75EE713940909BA380A2B2886245.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and
information.

796D9F5838704D2FB6DC45AB3E768272.description: Differentiate when situations call for formal or informal speech

E2EBA6CE0DE54EC98F2179CF98AFA57F.description: Identify characteristics of formal and informal speaking

7577B4B4317A4CD3AA5516ABA9EC10C8.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas)
and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussions);
use formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 4 Language
standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

A69B29B1E6C9470AB4EB0BCE6452B809.description:
Determine when to add audio recordings and visual displays to enhance the
development of main ideas or themes

246AF8B96F0F4BAAAC0730AC0A8671FD.description:
Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to
enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

51695B0F80E844068277DE8C7EB2FA81.description: Speak clearly and at an understandable pace

43BDFF33BB8040DFAF92948A00BC9D80.description: Determine facts and relevant descriptive details to support main ideas and themes

E4B1EECB355847CDB789A4C00366B60B.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized
manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or
themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

BA947B846417457FA5649FC9B81F2959.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

E66691DA45954701A76BB65C511C54FE.description:
Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media
and formats, including visually, quantitively, and orally.

19E085FCB0BD4BD791A1D624A92396EA.description: Explain personal ideas, opinions, and reasoning after discussion

516E7BFAB2B14FB788395C5B4674AA56.description: Identify key ideas presented during discussion

4DF84E04455B4EDEA637BC75981862F5.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding
in light of the discussion.

0E9EB6CE76614F9E9139091DBBFBE5DA.description: Formulate questions and responses to clarify or follow up on information

8176792EC65A4B62A2B711A9CA543EB9.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and
make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of
others.

9E9A0B37A9F041E28D931464DA3CA7C4.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussion and carry out assigned roles.

1A5E97A549934C9B98FC4D772B6EE04B.description: Use background information and information read to contribute to discussion.

CC95B8070CD54B4AA28829D868A17490.description: Identify key ideas from reading material

33B8FC5100894E0386D1943D700B5BFB.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups,
and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others'
ideas and expressing their own clearly.

13199639D0E74C129DFBFC100A5798A2.description: Identify words that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being

91A5B7209E374BC2A02BAC4414D2A413.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain
specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or
states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic
(e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

8DF920CA173344B0B825D51AB46BCF5E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites
(antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

E70038082CD4442F941846A0A5222799.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

7403A0F01F5F4B31864DEF4DFBC7BD39.description:
Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture)
in context.

E338D4C91E4949E28D198E5FCE326781.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

F34459A1AB064895947A6A37BB9914E2.description: Identify dictionaries, glossaries, and thesauruses as reference sources

85A988E5E8334E4FB3CB092506D00F90.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both
print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise
meaning of key words and phrases.

3663A8965E1D46F4A3FEDC22A65E7C7D.description: Explain the meaning of grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots

307B5A20D491447C903264C8AD9A16E9.description: Identify common grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots

7652F5D5AABA45089DB1D273150B6F81.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the
meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

C282C558A18448AD93280695292DBD4C.description: Identify definitions, examples, and restatements as context clues

9FCF30A85FFD4324A4AC52AF3A0D4C76.description:
Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the
meaning of a word or phrase.

8B844DC78A384ABFB3D36E62F7503FFD.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

E009A8C1C5254E5A911308C8A5E621F1.description: Differentiate when situations call for formal or informal speech

DB3AC641CF434FEBB748A432910853B3.description: Identify characteristics of formal and informal speaking

49437049A0F3440681BA1FBFDFD9381E.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas)
and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small - group
discussion).

27A68ABDBEB248ABB7CD82ABE95BDDFA.description: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.

4F0774C4826949A4A1E03E575CDC8BB3.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or
listening.

D190EA9ECE89442C84A273DD17BC960F.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

52A7D2B7CEF8451C96FA488F2BEC6D6B.description: Identify coordinating conjunctions (e.g. and, but, or)

87FE513FA0DD4D2EAFECB88B4E0E2C16.description: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

56FE78949B8840E1A4E4BC7F7423BBEA.description:
Identify use of commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from
a text

8DABAF438927407990DFC8CBB694B702.description:
Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a
text.

3E708B8FCC0C4EE98BC10A89F44F00B7.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

63E889BDE7B04276829BBB78F68CF3A3.description: Identify frequently confused words (homophones, homonyms, homographs)

BBC7BC8408FF475AB4A58739D46A8981.description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g. to, too, two; there, their).

23B3C932E44E4E5497A058463ED5A923.description:
Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate
fragments and run-ons.

E59C356EF2C647178C45C75E37423335.description:
Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a
small red bag rather than a red small bag).

A6297D389F704D2AA1A95ABBB6641325.description: Use modal auxillaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

80103A78FEBC4ACD964DA5BF194F7642.description:
Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking)
verb tenses.

CD7466981EEC40C585E253B7301B160F.description:
Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs
(when, where, why)

A86539F186D342438637279E9086909B.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.

821FDD9FCB6541C7B7C6CAB1FCFA4029.description: Explain how context can help to confirm or self-correct word recognition

E21A760F8FEA476A913E12B7E4881F4E.description: Apply rereading as a strategy when confirming or self-correcting words

320E9D1C88D844FFA6B507D6ED8F6602.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding,
rereading, as necessary.

52486534AC4B4F1C9D3F1334BDFD68C3.description: Apply reading strategies for accuracy, rate, and expression

6D7B6E79473F4564AC679A2311862C02.description:
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and
expression.

BD8A4AA9D19A48BBAE03AD92DC2A3082.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

C505A98708C14BC98210B883FD6F3DC3.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

E90EEA7C23834780B9E65DE3BCE0DC88.description: Read multisyllabic words in and out of context

179C8546A37B4BD2AB34DC03D25DC3C5.description: Explain meanings of prefixes and suffixes

58FEAB70EED44BFBBFF334FB7B9519C0.description: Identify root words, prefixes and suffixes

2778EEEB6FD24EE8B694E87B9E7758C0.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication
patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes)to read accurately unfamiliar
multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

D10DA8F0685F48F78D6535AD90CB998C.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

73671623EF904F44B07E52F06DE34A09.description:
Comprehend informational text in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

56D83968909D4A12A36758B62791D288.description:
Read informational text in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

DA7A05760D7747A1B6A464B0701ECAC3.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational text, including
history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 4 - 5 text complexity
band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

03019135B5B64376A9616CBF128AB907.description:
Comprehend literature in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

24FCE508D36C4FAEBEF15BD20815E054.description:
Read literature in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range

5FDDDA5E8C304B9BBE86161084C26E4F.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas,
and poetry in the grades 4 - 5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range.

31EC4B1F05B141938C5724478DE3E854.description: Evaluate information from two informational texts on the same topic

83C01BEE0CE0423A8BDB2DF0000CB79B.description: Organize information gathered from two texts on the same topic

BB32CBBD874147858E4767EAAC3EC64D.description: Identify information from two informational texts on the same topic

7DFEE6C0872947C786ABEFA27F72C856.description:
Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak
about the subject knowledgeably.

2BAB2A11BBB54032A94A2934ABDB70FB.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support points in informational text

F0B0D8F251BF404393DBBFED9A654371.description: Identify the author’s reasons and evidence in informational text

3E65F79B12BB43599374C6D09ACFC97E.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a
text.

36614E5B57994CF98D44DFD689E829A7.description:
Explain how information from charts, diagrams, graphs, timelines, animations, and
interactive elements in informational text contribute to an understanding of the text

EF332DF40E714C9F92493B4E86243191.description: Recognize charts, graphs, diagrams, timelines, etc. in informational text

A1BB048538AD4CEA9448E3B685819145.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts,
graphs, diagrams, timelines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and
explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it
appears.

50B1FDB175FC43B4A125863C284B534A.description:
Contrast specific details describing similar themes, topics, or patterns of events in
stories, myths, and traditional literature

120E28336D5A4C639396D15AFF529513.description:
Compare specific details describing similar themes, topics, or patterns of events in
stories, myths, and traditional literature

0C6A55801D644A18B0A2FB695D76AC10.description: Identify specific details describing themes, topics, or patterns of events

B417576070D3452C87A98120536F831B.description:
Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition
of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional
literature from different cultures.

80A58D995DB04BD496659B3C741F2B2A.description:
Contrast specific descriptions and directions between written and oral or visual
presentations of text

3031FD1E02FE487CAE09C947DE08840F.description:
Compare specific descriptions and directions between written and oral or visual
presentations of text

4D14B7B751F1469F8357920653C5E5B9.description: Identify connections between a text and a visual or oral presentation

C852829DF626428E9277AA783028B508.description:
Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral
presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specfic descriptions and
directions in the text.

1E59E16B95E5440E90AB3064516DB009.description:
Describe the differences in focus and information provided from firsthand and
secondhand accounts in informational text

670209BA9BE5443598BC8D22F026D6B1.description: Contrast firsthand and secondhand accounts of an event or topic in informational text

128FCE5F4B004C15AC12E507FA90D05A.description: Compare firsthand and secondhand accounts of an event or topic in informational text

0AFCA00DFCC24F83964E4C5D2D1C76CE.description:
Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or a
topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

67766410377E4597982BB3A6A85CAF6E.description: Describe the overall text structure of an informational text

C574E14B63074463AB597BA157095117.description: Identify overall types of text structure in informational text

D831984C3F2A4067B9B393A582F03328.description:
Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect,
problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

1B2B06B579D6414CB1917E8D702D70B9.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a
text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area

DA4277531B0342F3B67521B5484859CD.description: Identify domain specific words and phrases in informational text

31B375EDD7214125B30BC3050F50B81E.description: Identify general academic words and phrases in informational text

9E600AF8728A4AD6804868BA512C3233.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases
in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

99BEF021841B4E9AB9776AE8C123D674.description: Contrast the points of view (including first and third narrations)

66992E2BAC4943038CA2E8BF1D59D3AA.description: Compare the points of view (including first and third narrations)

697656302D594FD4BEE2F12C58797FE5.description: Identify point of view (including first and third narrations)

C308856425314922956C751DD4724B8A.description:
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated,
including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

4D315405DEC9475CBD867ADA1984FE73.description: Explain differences between poems, drama, and prose

DA106F64358D4CC5AB8B649D3013D1F7.description: Identify the structural elements of prose

32626FB04976425D88AF5657D7838B92.description:
Identify the structural elements of a drama (e.g. casts of characters, settings,
descriptions, dialogue, stage directions)

364E47B06870428586312E00E3C67CBC.description: Identify the structural elements of poems (e.g. verse, rhythm, and meter)

ED31E8CDF33C48E3AA365A866EAD3DE4.description:
Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the
structual elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, and meter) and drama (e.g., casts of
characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking
about a text.

99AED24AC3C249308527F76F13E727CD.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in text

7158744727184191938122E5FF5C7BFC.description: Identify words and phrases that allude to mythical characters

BBABBF576B494A2CAB1CA899B86845CC.description: Identify unknown words and phrases in text

86CBEC0A9B8044F8AD7B21F1B5638C5B.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

D31A3A462E9B4FA5A09985911E345BAF.description:
Explain how and why events, procedures, ideas, and concepts occurred with supporting
details in informational text

DB86793544B84FF090771A13B114EE65.description: Identify events, procedures, ideas, and concepts in informational text

C42075A6AD274BC7AB169621660411C7.description:
Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or
technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the
text.

3B4F6C0D0E5D4EF7A4DECC365AC9B8A5.description: Summarize text with key ideas and supporting details in informational text

915E4D940285468D8F0D4ECFF5CFC4CE.description: Explain how details support the main idea in informational text

2FD5516E77834B2EB91CCF3C79C0B197.description: Identify the main idea in informational text

D194986C1F554668A1B8E3F5FF1B099B.description:
Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details;
summarize the text.

50A71F4769204407B3662900B404F4D3.description: Differentiate between explicit and inferred information in informational text

61976314BDC84D37B06F2A5B14BC66B5.description: Identify key details and examples in an informational text

77B8CAD979A8463E8792A256F8D6FD77.description:
Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly
and when drawing inferences from the text.

97E9E467DCEA4E7CA026F0DE53C7023A.description: Identify specific details about characters, settings, and/or events

2771FEE3474140E6BD7F7FE276565454.description: Identify the character, setting, and/or event

D370C9FA89574073B45BF9736C958FB5.description:
Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on
specific details in the text (e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or action).

665CAE287F8641A89DDDBBB5DA91BC43.description: Summarize the text using key ideas and supporting details

3E231303DC854E46861F5AB04FC1E137.description: Determine the theme of a story, drama, or poem

F2B0BC0690CF4A548CA01E4485CC8923.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details from a text; summarize
the text.

C3FBD10415DF4A818574B7B18286ED38.description: Differentiate between explicit and inferred information

6178B82436A94AB3BCAE69C9446F931A.description: Identify key details and examples in a text

78ABBCDB118D43C983796A9812BD2576.description:
Refer to details and examples in the text when explaining what the text says
explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

C02EAE4C4CA546258EE8E5B12FF3DA4B.description: 4th Grade Reading: Literature and Informational Text
